intro: Aleuritia darialica, commonly known as the Darialic Alder, is a deciduous shrub native to the temperate regions of Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Hamamelidaceae family, which includes other notable species like the witch hazel. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that turn yellow in the fall, and its clusters of yellow-green flowers that bloom in early spring. Aleuritia darialica typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. It is often found in forest edges and along riverbanks, contributing to local biodiversity.
